results.title: The Old soldier
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
An excerpt from Charles Dickens’ “David Copperfield”. A crisis in the lives of Dr Strong and his young wife Annie is brought about by the selfishness and thoughtless interference of Annie’s mother, “the old soldier”, and the malicious manoeuvrings of Uriah Heep. How this misunderstanding develops and how it is cleared up with David Copperfield’s help is told.

results.title: An old box
results.creator_credit: Paul Driessen, Gaston Sarault and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated story of a beggar who repairs an old box, in order to set it up and ask for donations. As he stands in the street he gets cold, so he climbs into the box to keep warm. At once a spectacular star descends from the sky to the box and when it returns to the sky, it takes with it the ghost of the beggar. A film without words. (Awards: Chicago; San Franscisco; Melbourne; Dubuque: Los Angeles; Les Menuires.)

results.title: OK...Camera
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubbo, Ian McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Quebec produces many of the feature films made in Canada. The film looks at this unique, controversial industry; at the people who have succeeded in it (Genevieve Bujold is one) or failed; at its movies, which run the gamut from hard-core skinflicks to such highly acclaimed films as Mon oncle Antoine, and at its audiences, which number in the millions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Rubbo, Ian McLaren and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Nuclear reactor
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “College Physics”.
Discusses nuclear stability and neutron induced fission. Explains neutron emission, self-sustaining chain reaction, and the role of the moderator, Illustrates the application of these ideas to the pile and shows the production of plutonium and tracer elements.

results.title: Notes on a harpsichord
results.creator_credit: David Cheshire, John Read and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Craftsman”.
Follows a harpsichord from its construction to a concert performance. Philip Ledger, who is Musical Director of the Aldeburgh Festival and is one of Britain’s finest continuo players, describes the basic features of the harpsichord, and introduces the man who maintains and tunes his own harpsichord for concert performance - Malcolm Russell.

results.title: Northern Ireland
results.brief_description: A summary of the agriculture and industries of Northern Ireland. Following an introductory map, we see farm scenes and typical farming activities; hay making and harvesting oats and potatoes, harvesting and treatment of flax, digging peat for fuel; dairying and fishing. The film ends with the industries of Belfast, linen mills and ship building, and the export from Belfast of the products of Northern Ireland.

results.title: North of 60 east
results.creator_credit: E.L. Burnell, T.R. Wagstaff, Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: On patrol with the Royal Canadian Mounted Police of the eastern Canadian Arctic, north of the 60th parallel. This film shows the day-to-day routine of constables who police the vast area that includes Baffin and Ellesmere Islands. For those who might choose northern service, the film provides clear impressions of the requirements of this detachment; for the general audience it gives an interesting overall view of the people, life and environment in the eastern Arctic.

results.title: No toothache for Eskimos
results.brief_description: A 5-minute version of “Let’s keep our teeth” suitable for young children (8-11 years of age) which shows the tough primitive diet of the Eskimos. Children are attracted by the food sequences which, linked with points about the reasons for tooth decay, make a quick transition from amusement to instruction. Vividly portrays life in the Arctic.
